title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Fernando Mendoza, top NFL Draft QB prospect, expressed enthusiasm for potential mentorship from former Patriots QB Tom Brady with the Raiders.
Mendoza, a Boston native and Indiana Hoosiers star, completed a pre-draft interview with the Las Vegas Raiders and spoke briefly with Brady.
Mendoza won the 2025 Heisman Trophy and led the NCAA with 41 touchdowns, making him the likely No. 1 draft pick for the Raiders.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Kiss of the Spider Woman' featuring Jennifer Lopez is now streaming on Hulu.
'Paul McCartney: Man on the Run' documentary available on Prime Video.
Season 4 of 'Bridgerton' is streaming on Netflix focused on Benedict Bridgerton.

title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela collided during a Red Sox spring training game against the Braves.
Both players received medical attention but remained in the game, each recording hits in the third inning.
The collision was attributed to miscommunication, with Rafael more concerned about Anthony's condition post-collision.

title: Alex Cora to donate $20K to Jimmy Fund when 2026 Red Sox hit this milestone
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora pledges $20,000 donation to the Jimmy Fund once a player hits 20 home runs in 2026.
Cora's pledge marks his largest public donation to the Boston-based cancer research and care charity.
Last season, Red Sox players Trevor Story and Wilyer Abreu were the only ones to surpass the 20-home run mark.

title: N.H. House advances bill targeting ‘indoctrination’ in public schools
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The New Hampshire House passed the CHARLIE Act banning certain teachings like critical race theory and LGBTQ+ issues in schools.
The bill prohibits instruction that promotes division and mandates a 'neutral or patriotic disposition' in public education.
Teachers violating the Act could face disciplinary action, including credential revocation and potential lawsuits up to $10,000 per violation.

title: The story behind these colorful icicles in the Berkshires
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Colorful icicles along Route 2 in North Adams, MA are created using food coloring, a tradition dating back decades.
The Hairpin Turn on the Mohawk Trail offers panoramic views and features rainbow icicles made with water balloons and supersoakers.
Nearby attractions include The Golden Eagle Restaurant and MASS MoCA, one of the largest contemporary art museums in the country.

title: Mass. reports first two measles cases of 2026, including one in Greater Boston
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts confirms two measles cases, one in Greater Boston and the other a school-aged child diagnosed out-of-state.
The Greater Boston adult with measles recently returned from abroad and visited several locations while infectious.
Despite these cases, Massachusetts health officials say high vaccination rates keep the overall risk to residents low.

title: Local obituary: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, 33, lifelong South Boston resident and mother of 2
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Morgan Mallard-Vitiello, a 33-year-old mother of two, passed away on February 21, 2026, in South Boston.
Morgan, known as 'Hollywood,' worked at Boston's Inspectional Services and was beloved for her kindness.
Funeral services will be held at George F. Doherty & Sons in Dedham on March 3 and St. Mary Church on March 4.

title: She’s running Boston for The ALS Association in memory of her dad
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Lauren Hamilton, 26, from Tampa, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of her father who died of ALS.
Hamilton's father was a dedicated Boston salesman known for his kindness; she aims to honor his legacy through the race.
The run supports The ALS Association, emphasizing hope for future treatments and support for families affected by ALS.

title: DiZoglio files emergency motion after AG Campbell moves to strike down audit lawsuit
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio filed an emergency motion to counter AG Andrea Campbell's move to dismiss her audit lawsuit.
DiZoglio seeks a special assistant attorney general, claiming a conflict of interest and more time to respond to Campbell.
The dispute arises over DiZoglio's attempt to audit the Massachusetts Legislature, which leaders argue may violate separation of powers.
